item.title: RSC Combat Formula
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

I guess that is somewhat equal to the others… Atleast the output.

Here is mine:

[code]public static final int getCombatLevel(int attack, int defence, int strength, int hp, int ranged, int prayer, int magic) {
if(attack + strength < ranged * 1.5D) {
return (int)Math.floor(ranged * 0.375D + (defence + hp) * 0.25D + (prayer + magic) * 0.125D);
}

 return (int)Math.floor((attack + strength + defence + hp) * 0.25D + (prayer + magic) * 0.125D);

}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: RSC Combat Formula
item.dc:creator: @Velocity Velocity
item.description:
@Velocity wrote:

I don’t know if this is the one that is used on most private servers but I found it on Tip.it

public static double combatFormulaRSC(int attack, int strength, int defence, int hitpoints, int prayer, int ranged, int magic)
   {
      double combatLevel = ((defence + hitpoints) * 0.25) + ((magic + prayer) * 0.125);
      
      double warrior = (attack + strength) * 0.25;
      double ranger = ranged * 0.375;
      
      return combatLevel + (((ranged * 1.5) > (attack + strength)) ? ranger : warrior);
   }

Read full topic
